intro: Phlegmariurus linifolius, commonly known as the linear-leaf clubmoss, is a species of spore-bearing plant belonging to the family Lycopodiaceae. It is a small, evergreen plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky crevices. The plant has needle-like leaves that are arranged in whorls around the stem, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, cone-like structures called strobili, which contain the reproductive organs. Phlegmariurus linifolius plays a role in maintaining soil stability and providing habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
